page.title: 13TALKING ABOUT GIRLS' BRIGADE
page.content: We went to Saxon Street Methodist Church and talked to Mrs Jaggard, Captain of Saxon Street Girls' Brigade. She said she had been at Girls' Brigade for 37 years, and was there as one of the juniors when the Company was started. To earn a badge, they have to do something physical, meaning sports and things like that;something educational meaning learning about something, and something spiritual, meaning learning about God. Cubs, Brownies and other groups do not always learn about the bible. Girls' Brigade is held on a Wednesday. The Explorers, aged 5 to 8 years, start at 5.15pm and go on until 6.30pm. The Junior group from 8 to 11 years, starts at 6.30pm until 7.45pm, and the Senior group starts at 7.45 until 9.15. Seniors start at 11 years.
